means: Whigamores 维加摩尔斯（最初为西苏格兰一个反对教堂和国王的革命组织）
辉格党( Whig的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: The Whigs may attempt to belittle our candidates.
sentence.Network_cn: 辉格党人可能会试图贬低我们的候选人.

sentence.Network_en: In 19 th century terms 6 Taylor and Garnett were Whigs rather than militants.
sentence.Network_cn: 按19世纪的说法,泰勒和加纳特是辉格党人而不是激进分子.

sentence.Network_en: The election was a remarkable success for the whigs.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这次选举中,辉格党获得重大胜利.

list.abs: 辉格党（whig party）（Whig Party）为美国在杰克森式民主（Jacksonian democracy）时代的一个政党，自1832年至1835年间持续运作，反对安德 …
在美国内战之前的30年间，最能代表进步的新教教义的政党当属辉格党（Whig Party）。辉格党成立于19世纪20年代，随着时间推移…
[3] 所谓“辉格史学”(Whig history)，本义是指以英国辉格党（大约1860年以后称为自由党）的观点解释历史。辉格史学家将自己的信仰 …

entry.tran: (18和19世纪致力于政治和社会改革的)辉格党成员
entry.def: A Whig was a member of a British political party in the 18th and 19th centuries that was in favour of political and social changes.
In the American Revolution, a Whig was an American who supported the revolution against the British.

entry.tran: (美国19世纪的想要限制总统权力的)政党成员
entry.def: A Whig was a member of an American political party in the 19th century that wanted to limit the powers of the President.

auth_sentence.content: The Whigs tried repeatedly to add to the bill a sentence disavowing any censure of Judge Hall, but they failed.

auth_sentence.content: It wasn't easy at first, because Jackson's enemies, the Whigs, controlled both the House and the Senate.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It wasn't easy at first, because Jackson's enemies, the Whigs, controlled both the House and the Senate.

auth_sentence.content: The Whigs, on the other hand, called Jackson's acts both unconstitutional and unnecessary.
